page.title: 06Housing
page.content: Houses range from very old detached manor houses like the Lordship (where Dick Turpin is said to have stayed ) to a much smaller new council-owned terrace at Colliers End.Large isolated farmhouses,some dating back several hundred years,contrast with new bungalows.Latchford is a nucleated village located at a ford of the River.It is a mixture of old and new housing styles,well maintained and attractive in appearance.Barwick is also located at a ford ; it is a sprawling settlement and has a permanent residential caravan site. Up until 1950,there was a large American Army Base located at Colliers End.
